page.title: 09LEISURE
page.content: Our survey showed that the following hobbies are pursued ( in order of popularity): gardening, reading, television, sewing/knitting, sport, photography, painting and darts. The television is turned on for more than 12 hours a week in 65 homes, 4-12 hours a week in 60 homes and less than 4 hours a week in 13 homes. Nearly all homes have a T.V. set and three quarters have a telephone. Lack of transport restricts leisure pursuits in 20 homes, but in 128 it does not. 125 homes use cars, 25 bus, 9 cycle and 8 use other means to reach venues for leisure activities. In 150 homes, people eat or drink out locally but 75 prefer to stay at home; cost is a big factor.Libraries are popular:49 people use Cirencester,15 use Fairford and 16 use the mobile library. Two thirds of the adults go to bed after 10.30 pm.
